page.title: 06Central Darlaston.
page.content: The name Darlaston thought to be of Saxon origin - after{Deorlaf}which was settled in the 7C. Darlaston became an important centre for manufacture in metal after the industrial revolution. Some of the shops from the early 19C boom period still stand around the Bull Stake and Pinfold Street. There is some new shopping development in this area but there are lots of open spaces now. Darlaston was in the news in 1985 with the threatened closure of the{SERVIS}washing machine works. Metal fastenings are still made but many small fastenings works have closed in the last 10 years. The{ASDA} Superstore is the only major employer opened in recent years. This square has a number of pubs but {The Swan}and{The Bell,}or{Blue Bell} (from about 1700) are of particular interest.
